scripts.say: Hang in there, Hornet! I knew it was a bad idea to keep fighting with all those injuries...
Sorry, I'm just a little tired, that's all...
We'll handle things from here. Commander, you should stay with Hornet.
We instructed the accompanying destroyers to escort Hornet back to Newport Harbor.
The Siren fleet, cut off from its leadership, quickly fell into disarray. Though the battle continued, it was only a matter of time until they were completely routed.
However, this would still be the largest attack ever conducted on the Eagle Union's soil...
In accordance with Commander's orders, the rest of the fleet is to move to NY Harbor while we continue to carry out the evacuation.
Once we rendezvous with the ships already stationed there, we will—

sequence: <size=60>Attention, all fleets nearby NY Harbor. This is an emergency.</size>
<size=60>NY Harbor is currently under siege by the Sirens' main force. The situation is extremely dire.</size>
<size=60>The defensive fleet is currently engaging the enemy, but cannot hold out for long.</size>
<size=60>Destruction of the attacking Siren fleet and protecting NY Harbor are our top priorities.</size>
<size=60>Requesting immediate aid from any nearby fleets.</size>
